intro: Lindenbergia melvillei, commonly known as the Melville's lindenbergia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat vulnerability, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
